image.altText: fire at heathrow

props.synopsis: Counter-terrorism police are investigating the Heathrow fire that has brought thousands of flights to a stand still. Follow live.

title.children: Heathrow set to resume flights after fire cut power and sparked travel chaos

image.altText: A woman in a suit addresses a media conference, a man stands in the background.

props.synopsis: A workplace dispute between Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles and his former chief of staff has been settled, months after she alleged she was pushed out of her job for raising a bullying complaint against colleagues in the office.

title.children: Deputy PM's former chief of staff settles legal dispute with government

image.altText: Signs for Coles, Woolworths and Aldi supermarkets outside a shopping centre.

props.synopsis: Allegations of price gouging by the supermarket giants prompted an inquiry into the sector by the ACCC — but after a year of investigating, its final report hasn't been able to say whether it's taking place.

title.children: Are the supermarkets price gouging? It's 'very difficult' for the ACCC to say

image.altText: Woman stands against wall with Art Gallery NSW logo, wearing white pant-suit and smiling widely.

props.synopsis: Maud Page, the gallery's deputy director, will take on the top job next week, following the resignation of outgoing director Michael Brand in October, after 13 years.

title.children: After 154 years, the first woman is chosen to lead this major art gallery

image.altText: Demolition of the former St Andrew's hostel in Katanning

props.synopsis: Demolition has begun at the site of one of state's worst cases of institutionalised child sexual abuse, where dozens of boys were harmed by paedophile Dennis John McKenna.

title.children: 'House of horrors' demolished as 'part of cleansing process' for survivors

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Income and property price caps for the housing scheme are set to rise as part of next week's federal budget.

title.children: Labor to lift income and property price caps on 'Help to Buy' scheme

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses holding up dead rat

props.synopsis: A bin strike in Birmingham has resulted in rubbish piling up in the streets and sparked warnings about "rats the size of cats", with residents claiming the rodents are "just everywhere".

title.children: Rubbish piles up in Birmingham with 'rats the size of cats', residents say

image.altText: Reece Walsh of the Brisbane Broncos passes the ball against the Cowboys.

props.synopsis: The Broncos beat the Cowboys 26-16 in a scrappy Queensland derby at Lang Park after the Warriors show their mettle in a 14-6 win over the Roosters.

title.children: 'Let it go': Broncos want Walsh to forget errors in win over Cowboys

image.altText: A photo of a scorched sign on a building reading 'pulse'.

props.synopsis: Thirteen people including a former government minister have been arrested in North Macedonia on Friday over a nightclub blaze that killed 59 people including six minors.

title.children: Thirteen arrested over North Macedonia nightclub fire which killed 59

image.altText: Steele Sidebottom and a number of Collingwood players celebrate wildly

props.synopsis: Steele Sidebottom kicks the winning goal as Collingwood beats Footscray by just six points in a heart-stopping and emotional game at the MCG.

title.children: Collingwood breaks Footscray hearts in game of the season contender

image.altText: Mariah Carey performs in Times Square

props.synopsis: A lawsuit claiming All I Want For Christmas Is You infringed the copyright of an earlier song with the same title is dismissed without trial.

title.children: 'No evidentiary support': US judge rules Mariah Carey did not steal most famous song

image.altText: A building with a sign 'Queanbeyan Courthouse'

props.synopsis: A NSW woman previously charged for hitting her 13-year-old son while chastising him for disobeying a technology ban has successfully appealed her conviction.

title.children: Woman who hit son during technology ban row wins conviction appeal

image.altText: Sayet Erhan Akca standing in a gym in a black singlet

props.synopsis: The man is alleged to have helped Sayet Erhan Akca sail from Australia to Thailand in late 2023 to escape drug importation charges.

title.children: Man charged over allegedly smuggling Dural caravan suspect out of Australia

image.altText: Bunch of white, oval medication tablets and white medication capsules.

props.synopsis: America's pharmaceutical giants have been plotting to torpedo Australia's Pharmaceuticals Benefits Scheme, despite securing major concessions 20 years ago.

title.children: Why big US pharma hates Australia and has for decades

image.altText: volcano 2

props.synopsis: A volcanic eruption in Indonesia disrupted Bali flight schedules on Friday.

title.children: Flights to Bali resume after volcanic eruption grounded planes

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Several people holding down a teenage boy in an aeroplane

props.synopsis: The identities of foreigners a 17-year-old may have spoken to before allegedly trying to hijack a Jetstar plane will be kept secret for at least three months.

title.children: Names of foreigners suppressed in case of teen accused of plane hijack attempt

image.altText: A row of cybertrucks

props.synopsis: US regulators have recalled 46,000 Cybertrucks in the latest in a series of call-backs for the controversial pick-up truck.

title.children: Cybertrucks are being recalled in the US. Will they ever hit Australian roads?

image.altText: Green lawn and a straight path lead to steps to an old fashioned building

props.synopsis: The 58-year-old man, who the ABC cannot legally identify, sexually assaulted the girl between 2015 and 2017.

title.children: West Australian man found guilty of raping 7yo girl

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk holding a black folder open with yellow-gold curtains and two flags behind him.

props.synopsis: Silicon Valley, whose top executives have cultivated close relationships with Donald Trump, is now pushing him to pressure Australia to relax its regulations or risk retaliation.

title.children: Tech titans ask Trump to take up fight against Australian regulation

image.altText: A chrome coloured crushed ute abandoned on the street in Port Vila's town centre.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu is one of the most disaster-prone nations on the planet, with cyclones, earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. And its people now face an unsettling question: how many disasters can one nation take?

title.children: Vanuatu's capital is a ghost town — some say it might be 'finished'

image.altText: donald trump and a school child hold up signed executive orders

props.synopsis: The order would leave school policy almost entirely in the hands of states and local boards, a prospect that alarms many within the US education system.

title.children: Trump signs order aimed at dismantling US Department of Education

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

props.synopsis: Digital rights group Noyb says the chatbot generated inaccurate personal data, violating EU privacy rules.

title.children: OpenAI faces complaint after ChatGPT 'hallucinated' man murdered his sons

image.altText: A police car and road closed sign at a road block near the site of the light aircraft crash near Ogilvie.

props.synopsis: Police say the pilot, aged in his 60s, was the sole occupant of the light aircraft that crashed near Ogilvie, about 500km north of Perth.

title.children: Man killed in light plane crash north of Geraldton

image.altText: A blow up pool with three people swimming in it

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory education minister has suggested remote school students can take swimming lessons in large blow-up pools "from Clark Rubber" in response to questions about how they can access the government's free swimming lessons policy.

title.children: Minister suggests 'blow-up pools' for remote NT swimming lessons

image.altText: cactus close up

props.synopsis: Two poorly placed cacti more than 50 years ago have turned into a full-scale invasion. It's prompting calls for people to dispose of their cacti safely to avoid a very prickly problem.

title.children: Two pot plants left behind 60 years ago became a sprawling infestation

image.altText: An empty foyer in a concrete and wood-panelled building.

props.synopsis: The government has boosted funding for the Office of National Intelligence after releasing a major review of Australia's spy agencies.

title.children: Long-awaited spy agency review released after fears it would be buried

image.altText: Graffiti tagged on the side of a building with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Police allege the man targeted two homes, a Jewish school and a shopping centre with antisemitic graffiti.

title.children: 41yo accused of spraying 'vile' graffiti on Sydney school and homes

image.altText: A man in a suit walks down court steps in front of other people

props.synopsis: A man who pretended to be a nurse at one of Adelaide's major hospitals has shown "limited insight" into his offending and has a "narcissistic component" to his personality, a court hears.

title.children: Nurse impersonator's apology leaves magistrate 'somewhat troubled'

image.altText: Peter Dutton is shown at a press conference. He's wearing glasses and a black suit with an Australian flag behind him.

props.synopsis: It's a weird time when your friends become almost as problematic as your potential enemies, but that's the situation we face.

title.children: Dutton says he could handle Trump, but can any Australian PM?

image.altText: young baby wrapped in a blanket after being pulled from rubble in gaza

props.synopsis: After hearing cries of a baby from underneath concrete rubble in Khan Younis, rescuers dig down to find the infant alive.

title.children: Baby rescued from rubble after air strike in Gaza killed her family

image.altText: Basil talking to reporters

props.synopsis: The WA Liberals are staring down the very real possibility of remaining the state's second-tier opposition party for the next four years as the tight race for lower house seats continues.

title.children: Tense wait for WA Liberals in tight race over opposition party status

image.altText: a female students at an exam table

props.synopsis: International students have been "thrown under the bus" and unfairly blamed for the rental crisis, according to new study.

title.children: 'Thrown under the bus': Study concludes international students not to blame for rising rents
